title: We don't want to thwart Brexit, but the DUP will never support a deal that harms Northern Ireland
text:
Since he became Prime Minister, we have worked closely with Boris Johnston to help him deliver on his promise to take the UK as a whole out of the EU.

We acknowledge that the Prime Minister and his team have sought to acquaint themselves with our concerns, keeping us informed of how negotiations have been progressing and highlighting the sticking points which arose with the EU negotiators and especially the difficult demands of the Irish.

In turn we have sought to be flexible and stretched ourselves so as to give the Prime Minister some latitude to reach a fair deal with the EU.

The result of our discussions enabled the PM to address one of the EU's central concerns about protecting their single...
description: Since he became Prime Minister, we have worked closely with Boris Johnston to help him deliver on his promise to take the UK as a whole out of the EU.
